# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

reasoning:
**Balatro Strategy: Shop Reroll**

Okay, so I'm in the Shop phase of Ante 6, Round 17. Let's take stock. I've got $58 and a solid Flush build going, thanks to Crafty, Four Fingers, and Vampire. My plan is to lean heavily into Flushes and scale Vampire with enhanced cards. The shop currently only offers Clever Joker, which is useless for my Flush strategy, as it adds chips to Two Pair. The Hanged Man is a nice consumable, but I can't use it in the shop. I need to save it for the next round. Seltzer is fantastic for retriggering hands, but it’s temporary.

My key priorities right now are booster packs – specifically Tarot Packs to enhance cards, Planet Packs to level up my Flush, and Standard Packs for more fodder for Vampire. I need to reroll the shop.

I need to quickly assess my Jokers. Crafty and Four Fingers are the foundation. Vampire's my primary scaling, and Bootstraps adds multiplicative Mult. The "To the Moon" Joker is a mixed bag, significantly increasing my interest, but I should check the rules because it might be capped. It doubles the interest rate, but might not bypass the $5 cap. I suspect it does not, but I should double check. Zany will add Mult if I play a Three of a Kind, and Seltzer for retriggers. With Four Fingers, it might be possible to score a Three of a Kind with a 4-card Flush, which would trigger Zany.

My money is right at the interest sweet spot, but rerolling at $7 will hurt, but the chance of getting a great booster pack is worth the cost. Rerolling would put me at $51, reducing Bootstraps from +22 Mult to +20. It's a calculated risk. I'm going to reroll the shop to find the boosters I need.
